==Events==
* [[927]] &ndash; Death of [[Simeon I the Great]], the first Bulgarian to be recognized as Emperor.
*[[1120]] &ndash; [[Richard III of Capua]] is anointed as [[List of Princes of Capua|Prince]] two weeks before his untimely death.
*[[1153]] &ndash; [[Malcolm IV of Scotland|Malcolm IV]] becomes King of [[Scotland]].
*[[1199]] &ndash; [[John, King of England|John]] is crowned King of [[England]].
*[[1644]] &ndash; [[Manchu]] regent [[Dorgon]] defeats rebel leader [[Li Zicheng]] of the [[Shun dynasty]] at the [[Battle of Shanhai Pass]], allowing the Manchus to enter and conquer the capital city of [[Beijing]].
*[[1703]] &ndash; [[Tsar]] [[Peter I of Russia|Peter the Great]] founds the city of [[Saint Petersburg]].
*[[1798]] &ndash; The [[Battle of Oulart Hill]] takes place in [[Wexford]], [[Ireland]].
*[[1799]] &ndash; [[War of the Second Coalition]]: [[Habsburg Monarchy|Austrian]] forces [[Battle of Winterthur (1799)|defeats]] the [[French First Republic|French]] at [[Winterthur]], [[Switzerland]], securing control of the northeastern Swiss Plateau because of the town's location at the junction of seven cross-roads.
*[[1813]] &ndash; [[War of 1812]]: In [[Canada]], [[United States|American]] forces capture [[Battle of Fort George|Fort George]].
*[[1849]] &ndash; The Great Hall of [[Euston railway station|Euston station]] in [[London]] is opened.
*[[1860]] &ndash; [[Giuseppe Garibaldi]] begins his attack on [[Palermo]], [[Sicily]], as part of the [[Italian Unification]].
*[[1863]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: First Assault on the [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] works at the [[Siege of Port Hudson]].
*[[1874]] &ndash; The first group of [[Dorsland Trek|Dorsland trekkers]] under the leadership of [[Gert Alberts]] leaves [[Pretoria]].
*[[1883]] &ndash; [[Alexander III of Russia|Alexander III]] is crowned Tsar of [[Russia]].
*[[1896]] &ndash; The [[Fujita scale|F4]]-strength [[St. Louis-East St. Louis Tornado]] hits in [[St. Louis, Missouri]], and [[East Saint Louis, Illinois]], killing at least 255 people and causing $2.9&nbsp;billion in damage ([[1997]] [[United States dollar|USD]]).
*[[1905]] &ndash; [[Russo-Japanese War]]: The [[Battle of Tsushima]] begins.
*[[1907]] &ndash; [[Bubonic plague]] breaks out in [[San Francisco, California]].
*[[1908]] &ndash; [[Khilafat Day]] – the day of establishment of Khilafat in Islam Ahmadiyya.
*[[1919]] &ndash; The [[NC-4]] aircraft arrives in [[Lisbon]] after completing the first [[transatlantic flight]].
*[[1927]] &ndash; The [[Ford Motor Company]] ceases manufacture of the [[Ford Model T]] and begins to retool plants to make the [[Ford Model A (1927)|Ford Model A]].
*[[1930]] &ndash; The {{convert|1046|ft|m}} [[Chrysler Building]] in [[New York City]], the [[List of tallest buildings in the world|tallest man-made structure]] at the time, opens to the public.
*[[1933]] &ndash; [[New Deal]]: The U.S. [[Federal Securities Act]] is signed into law requiring the registration of securities with the [[Federal Trade Commission]].
*  1933   &ndash; [[The Walt Disney Company]] releases the [[cartoon]] ''[[Three Little Pigs (film)|Three Little Pigs]]'', with its hit song "[[Who's Afraid of the Big Bad Wolf?]]"
*  1933   &ndash; The [[Century of Progress]] [[World's Fair]] opens in [[Chicago]], [[Illinois]].
*[[1935]] &ndash; New Deal: The [[Supreme Court of the United States]] declares the [[National Industrial Recovery Act]] to be unconstitutional in [[A.L.A. Schechter Poultry Corp. v. United States]], (295 U.S. 495).
*[[1937]] &ndash; In [[California]], the [[Golden Gate Bridge]] opens to pedestrian traffic, creating a vital link between [[San Francisco]] and [[Marin County, California]].
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: In the [[Le Paradis massacre]], 99 soldiers from a [[Royal Norfolk Regiment]] unit are shot after surrendering to [[Nazi Germany|German]] troops; two survive.
*[[1941]] &ndash; World War II: The [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]] proclaims an "unlimited national emergency".
*  1941   &ndash; World War II: The German battleship ''[[German battleship Bismarck|Bismarck]]'' is sunk in the [[North Atlantic]] killing almost 2,100 men.
*[[1942]] &ndash; World War II: In [[Operation Anthropoid]], [[Reinhard Heydrich]] is fatally wounded in [[Prague]]; he dies of his injuries eight days later.
*[[1958]] &ndash; The [[F-4 Phantom II]] makes its first flight.
*[[1960]] &ndash; In [[Turkey]], a [[1960 Turkish coup d'état|military coup]] removes President [[Celal Bayar]] and the rest of the democratic government from office.
*[[1962]] &ndash; The [[Centralia mine fire]] is ignited in the town's landfill above a coal mine.
*[[1965]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: American warships begin the first bombardment of [[National Front for the Liberation of Vietnam|National Liberation Front]] targets within [[South Vietnam]].
*[[1967]] &ndash; [[Australia]]ns vote in favor of a [[Australian referendum, 1967 (Aboriginals)|constitutional referendum]] granting the Australian government the power to make laws to benefit [[Indigenous Australians]] and to count them in the national [[census]].
*  1967   &ndash; The [[U.S. Navy]] [[aircraft carrier]] {{USS|John F. Kennedy|CV-67|6}} is [[Ship naming and launching|launched]] by [[Jacqueline Kennedy]] and her daughter [[Caroline Kennedy|Caroline]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; The meeting of the [[Union Nationale des Étudiants de France]] (National Union of the Students of France) takes place. 30,000 to 50,000 people gather in the [[Stade Sebastien Charlety]].
*  1968   &ndash; [[Major League Baseball]]'s [[National League]] awards [[Montreal, Quebec|Montreal]] the first franchise in Canada and the first franchise outside the [[United States]]. (the [[Montreal Expos]])
*[[1971]] &ndash; The [[Dahlerau train disaster]], the worst railway accident in [[West Germany]], kills 46 people and injures 25 near [[Wuppertal]].
*[[1975]] &ndash; [[Dibbles Bridge Coach Crash]] near [[Grassington]], in [[North Yorkshire]], [[England]], kills 33 – the highest ever death toll in a road accident in the [[United Kingdom]].
*[[1980]] &ndash; The [[Gwangju Massacre]]: Airborne and army troops of [[South Korea]] retake the city of [[Gwangju]] from civil militias, killing at least 207 and possibly many more.
*[[1983]] &ndash; [[Webb Farm disaster]]: a massive explosion at a secret unlicensed [[fireworks]] plant near [[Benton, Tennessee]], kills eleven, injures one, and causes damage within a radius of several miles.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1314&dat=19830530&id=5O0vAAAAIBAJ&sjid=2-4DAAAAIBAJ&pg=6978,8211234 |title=Fireworks suspect charged with deaths |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=May 30, 1983 |publisher=Google News |accessdate=April 19, 2013}}</ref>
*[[1986]] &ndash; ''[[Dragon Warrior|Dragon Quest]]'', the game credited as setting the template for [[role-playing video games]], is released in [[Japan]]. 
*[[1995]] &ndash; In [[Culpeper, Virginia]], the actor [[Christopher Reeve]] is paralyzed from the neck down after falling from his [[horse]] in a riding competition.
*[[1996]] &ndash; [[First Chechnya War]]: the [[President of Russia|Russian President]] [[Boris Yeltsin]] meets with [[Chechnya]]n rebels for the first time and negotiates a cease-fire.
*[[1997]] &ndash; The unusual [[1997 Central Texas tornado outbreak|tornado outbreak]] in [[Jarrell, Texas]].
*[[1997]] &ndash; The U.S. Supreme Court rules that [[Paula Jones]] can pursue her sexual harassment lawsuit against President [[Bill Clinton]] while he is in office.
*[[1998]] &ndash; [[Oklahoma City bombing]]: [[Michael Fortier (American)|Michael Fortier]] is sentenced to 12 years in prison and fined $200,000 for failing to warn authorities about the [[terrorism|terrorist]] plot.
*[[2001]] &ndash; Members of the [[Islamism|Islamist]] separatist group [[Abu Sayyaf]] [[Dos Palmas kidnappings|seize twenty hostages]] from an affluent island resort on [[Palawan]] in the [[Philippines]]; the hostage crisis would not be resolved until June 2002.
*[[2006]] &ndash; The [[May 2006 Java earthquake]] strikes devastating [[Bantul]] and the city of [[Yogyakarta (city)|Yogyakarta]] killing over 6,600 people.
*[[2009]] &ndash; A [[2009 Lahore bombing|suicide bombing]] kills at least 35 people and injures 250 more in [[Lahore]], [[Pakistan]].
